refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The XSL formatter supports three backends: AntennaHouse, FOP, and RenderX.
Select the backend using the com.xmlcalabash.fo-processor system property or the fo-processor configuration setting.

Each processor accepts configuration parameters (using the parameter input port or explicit p:with-param instructions) to control its behavior. The specific parameters accepted, and their meanings, are implementation dependent.

refsection.title: AntennaHouse properties
refsection.para:
AntennaHouse accepts the following properties:
EmbedAllFontsEx ExitLevel ImageCompression NoAccessibility NoAddingOrChangingComments NoAssembleDoc NoChanging NoContentCopying NoFillForm NoPrinting OptionsFileURI OwnersPassword TwoPassFormatting

refsection.title: FOP properties
refsection.para:
FOP accepts the following properties:
Accessibility Author Base14KerningEnabled BaseURL BreakIndentInheritanceOnReferenceAreaBoundary ConserveMemoryPolicy CreationDate Creator FontBaseURL HyphenBaseURL Keywords LocatorEnabled PageHeight PageWidth Producer SourceResolution StrictUserConfigValidation StrictValidation Subject TargetResolution TargetResolution Title UseCache UserConfig

refsection.title: RenderX properties
refsection.para: The RenderX formatter uses its own system property, com.renderx.xep.CONFIG to specify the formatter properties.

refsection.title: Implementation
refsection.para: This step is implemented by the xmlcalabash1-print module. The jar file from that project must be in the class path in order to use this step.
